title: Lip Job Gone Wrong: Woman Goes To Get Lip Fillers, Ends Up With Lumpy, Swollen Lips!
text:
Lip Job Gone Wrong: Woman Goes To Get Lip Fillers, Ends Up With Lumpy, Swollen Lips!

Lip Job Gone Wrong: Woman Goes To Get Lip Fillers, Ends Up With Lumpy, Swollen Lips!

Sometimes even the most complicated surgeries end up being successful without any complications at all, and sometimes the simplest of procedures can become a nightmare for someone.

Sarah Najjar’s lips deflated after her 30th birthday, so she decided to pay £300 for a procedure to get a lip filler. However, it went horribly wrong and turned out to be a disaster, she was left with “huge blue lumps” in her lips.

She admired the "pillowed pouts" fillers that a lot of other people had and wanted to get them too, but she ended up with lumpy and swollen lips.

PA Real Life

She had to actually shell out extra £700 to get the fillers dissolved. She was so traumatised by the entire experience that she decided to ‘train in facial aesthetics to prevent others from suffering the same fate as her’, according to Mirror.

Don't Miss 28.9 K SHARES 11.9 K SHARES 6.9 K SHARES 3.9 K SHARES 6.5 K SHARES

This is what she reportedly said about the entire experience, “My lips swelled up after I had the filler injected, which I initially thought was normal – but after a week you could see all these huge blue lumps and they felt rock hard. You could see them when I was talking. I was so self-conscious."

PA Real Life

“I was in shock at what I ended up going through for what I’d thought was a simple procedure."

"As a result, I decided to train in facial aesthetics to understand what had gone wrong – but now, I also want to help other people looking to get fillers done to make sure they understand the risks."

"I get so many women coming in for corrective work after getting botched fillers, and they always say the same thing, "I went somewhere cheap'."

PA Real Life

"But you have to think, it’s cheap for a reason, and it ends up costing you far more to fix it.”

She explained: “My lips were very lumpy and uneven, so I went back to the injector who had done them, and they suggested that even more filler would even them out."

“Looking back, I know that’s not right now, but at the time, I trusted what I was being told and just wanted it fixed."

“So, I had another one milliliter injected – meaning I’d had two milliliters in just two weeks."

“I woke up and my lips were more swollen than ever – literally about two centimetres in front of my face – and rock hard.”

PA Real Life

Now that she is a trained professional at The Dental Surgery in Clifton Village, Bristol, she uses her experience to warn others of the risk involved in the procedure.

“I was never told about risks or complications, so I want to make sure that the patients who come to me understand exactly what will happen before I put that needle in,'' Mirror quoted her saying.

It is commendable that she wants to make sure that no one has to go through the painful experience that she went through.
description: Sometimes even the most complicated surgeries become successful without any complications and sometimes the simplest of procedure can become a nightmare for someone. Sarah Najjar’s lips deflated after her 30th birthday so she decided to pay £300 for a procedure to get lip filler.
